oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Program, The Nashville Community Playhouse, presentation of “Tonight At Eight-Thirty,” 1946-1947 Season
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A Nashville Community Playhouse program for a theatrical production of Noel Coward’s “Tonight At Eight-Thirty,” presented during the 1946-47 season. The production was directed by Raymond Johnson; Setting and Lighting by Wyman Kane; Dances directed by Mrs. Walter Fort; Music directed by Majorie Cooney; Martha Eatherly and Dr. Cromwell Tidwell (at the two pianos); and detailed set painting by Frank Suiter. The play, “Tonight At Eight-Thirty,” was presented on “…alternating performances, November 20-23, 1946.” Forms part of the Wilhelmina Webb Collection. 1 program.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johnson, Raymond
